body_html: Hey, PyTorch is great already--I recently migrated everything over from TensorFlow in half the code and 1/5 the time. I can certainly help write better error messages, but I am a researcher with little to no experience deving on large frameworks. I realize that priorities have to be set--my hope is just that this thread is kept somewhere for eventual consideration, as there's definitely another 2-3X productivity to be squeezed out of debugging time. Seconded that a developer/debug mode should be introduced at some point

body: Hey, PyTorch is great already--I recently migrated everything over from TensorFlow in half the code and 1/5 the time. I can certainly help _write_ better error messages, but I am a researcher with little to no experience deving on large frameworks. I realize that priorities have to be set--my hope is just that this thread is kept somewhere for eventual consideration, as there's definitely another 2-3X productivity to be squeezed out of debugging time. Seconded that a developer/debug mode should be introduced at some point
